messages.message: I have a larger existential question, do we need to think about when we now use Abby vs Microsoft OCR for solutions? Has this been thought of from a engineering strategy? I plan to get a larger deal in place to make sure we have Microsoft as a definitive solution (at the very least trying to get an obligation that we will always have access to the last build they gave us but maybe not future builds, this is still in the works). We have 0 things in place to make sure we have Microsoft OCR as a guarantee so curious how you are all thinking about it.

That’s interesting, was not aware of this. Are we saying that we may not have access to microsoft OCR at some point in future?

Some of our customers like SC are depending on the MSFT OCR for pushing solutions fwd
Its more so that we have no guarentees in place right now…

I have to go back and figure out with the leadership team how we put a plan in place that we will always have access to some degree. Right now Microsoft is doing us a favor by letting us have access to their containers.

I got us the ability to get access and resell it (which is a first for their Cognitive Services team) now its how do we cement it. I have a meeting next week with a senior leader at their cog services so I should get more line of sight but want to flag it as something we have to be conscious of.
